text: Mr. Harrison’s Confessions is an episodic 1851 long short story or novella (over 29,000 words) by Elizabeth Gaskell about a doctor in provincial England. It is notable for being a prequel to her novel Cranford. With Cranford, "The Last Generation in England", and My Lady Ludlow, it was adapted for TV in 2007 as Cranford. ==External links== *Mr. Harrison's Confessions * *Marie Fitzwilliam, "Mr Harrison's Confessions": A Study of the General Practitioner's Social and Professional Disease in Mid-Nineteenth Century England (The Gaskell Society Journal, Volume 12 - 1998 - pp. 28-36) * Category:Prequel novels Category:Short stories by Elizabeth Gaskell Category:1851 short stories
